Eyewitness accounts: The expert mentions that there were dozens of eyewitnesses who witnessed the incident. Their testimonies provide evidence to verify the claim.
Accident report: The expert refers to the accident report, which states that a Little Rock woman was killed after leaping through her moving car's sunroof. This official document supports the authenticity of the incident.
Police officer: s statement: The expert quotes Paul Madison, the first officer on the scene, who describes the incident as "the strangest thing" he has seen. His statement adds credibility to the claim.
Origin of the story: The expert reveals that the story was written by Elroy Willis and released on the internet in 2001. This information confirms that the incident was a work of fiction and not a real event.
